column4: hoary uses xorg, which has xorg.conf.  xfree86 does not have continuing development, because it has a tainted non-free licence; all the current development is happening in x.org.  so, to answer your question: newer features, far better hardware support, just lots of random fixes.
x was never gpl -- it's a mix of three-clause bsd and mit/x11.
xfree86 tried to use the four-clause bsd licence, which is non-free.
cool, I should up to hoary, then :p
